{{multiple issues| {{COI|date=July 2018}} {{peacock|date=July 2018}} }} '''Evzen Korec''' (born September 16, 1956) is a Czech scientist and businessman, owner of the property developer [[EKOSPOL]] and owner and director of [[Tabor Zoo]].<ref>[http://budejovice.idnes.cz/evzen-korec-koupi-zoo-v-tabore-deo-/budejovice-zpravy.aspx?c=A150421_2157045_budejovice-zpravy_jkr Businessman Korec bought Tabor zoo]</ref> He is the co-author of 11 patents and more than 20 research articles published in international scientific journals. Korec has also written four books, one of which (''Co je v domě, není pro mě!'') became a bestseller shortly after publication.<ref>[http://www.denik.cz/trendy/touzite-investovat-do-nemovitosti-ne-otevrit-oci-by-vam-mohla-nova-kniha-2014060.html Unique book about investing in real estates]</ref>
== Education and scientific career == {{unreferenced section|date=June 2018}} Korec graduated from the Faculty of Science, [[Charles University]] in 1981, in Molecular Biology and Genetics. His Master's thesis was an Analysis of Susceptibility and Resistance to Rous Sarcoma Virus in Inbred Line of Minor Poultry. Between 1983 and 1986 he worked as a researcher at the Institute of Molecular Genetics of the [[Czechoslovak Academy of Sciences]], where he received a PhD in [[Oncology]], with a doctoral thesis on the Expression and Detection of Virus Proteins of Tumor Viruses.
After 1986, Korec completed long-term research fellowships at universities across Europe, including the [[University of Göttingen]] in Germany, and universities in London and Paris. He was the co-author of 11 patents in the field of Molecular Biology and Genetics. In this field he published more than 20 research articles in international scientific journals.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/?term=korec+e|title=korec e - PubMed - NCBI|last=pubmeddev|website=www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov|access-date=5 May 2017}}</ref>
==Business career== In 1992 he founded the development company EKOSPOL, and has served as its CEO and chairman since then. EKOSPOL is one of the two largest residential developers in the Czech Republic,<ref>[http://www.hypoindex.cz/developersky-trh-v-praze-miri-k-triumviratu-koncentrace-trhu-bude-pokracovat/ Development market in Prague is heading to the triumvirate, market concentration will continue]</ref> according to market share of apartment sales, and has also been listed among the 50 leading residential developers in Central and Eastern Europe by a trade magazine.<ref>[http://www.grupa-eco.pl/images/pdf/20120401_CIJ_TOP_50_SIN_67632462.pdf 50 leading residential developers in Central and Eastern Europe]</ref>
Korec lectures regularly at the [[University of Economics, Prague|University of Economics in Prague]],<ref>[http://www.vse.cz/zpravodaj/846 Report on the conference - Factors prosperity of enterprises in the local and global environment 2013]</ref> and frequently comments on residential development, construction, housing market and the mortgage market in Czech media. Between 2010 and 2016 he was the most frequently quoted public figure in the Czech development industry, and EKOSPOL was the most frequently mentioned development company in the media.<ref>[http://stavebni-forum.cz/cs/article/23735/developeri-v-mediich-evzen-korec-a-ekospol-posilili-sve-pozice/ Czech developers in media: Evžen Korec and EKOSPOL have strengthened positions]</ref>
In 2013, Korec received the Top Manager of the Sector of Real Estate Development and Construction Award in the Manager of the Year 2012 Awards.<ref>[http://www.buildingnews.cz/zpravy-dne/evzen-korec-je-manazerem-roku-v-odvetvi-vystavby-a-developmentu.html TOP Manager of the Sector of Real Estate Development and Construction]</ref>
=== Korec's rule === As the owner of Ekospol development company, Korec formulated Korec's rule, which says: ''"The final sales price of an apartment with the area of up to 50 m2 must correspond to a maximum of 20 times the annual rent in a given location. For larger apartments (large one bedroom apartment, two bedroom apartment etc.) the sales price should be on the level of a maximum of 25 to 30 times the annual rent."''<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/965748296|title=Finanční gramotnost|last=Miroslav.|first=Škvára,|isbn=9788090482333|edition=Druhé vydání|location=Praha|oclc=965748296}}</ref>
Korec's rule helps a person interested in buying an apartment to relatively precisely determine the maximum sales price of an apartment in a given location. This rule applies generally, independent of the location. The rent price already reflects the attractiveness of the location, and the current rent price of a given location can be easily found on real estate websites.
== Animal protection == Korec is also active in the field of animal protection and preservation. In 2015, Korec rescued [[Tabor Zoo]] from liquidation, buying the zoo from an insolvency administrator. The zoo was re-opened to the public later that year, focused on the preservation of endangered species. Korec is himself a breeder of various animals, including [[Koi|koi carp]] and horses. He is the owner of Korec Corso kennel, home to the most successful bitch of the [[Cane Corso]] dog breed in the Czech Republic in 2015, Koleta Atison.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.koreccorso.cz/en/about-us/|title=About us {{!}} Korec Corso - Chovatelská stanice Cane Corso Italiano|website=www.koreccorso.cz|language=en-US|access-date=2017-05-05}}</ref>
Through his company EKOSPOL, Korec supports the civic association Společnost pro zvířata ("Society for Animals") and charitable trust Česká Krajina, as well as sponsoring Tabor Zoo.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://spolecnostprozvirata.cz/podporili-nas/|title=Podpořili nás {{!}} SPOLEČNOST PRO ZVÍŘATA ZO ČSOP|website=spolecnostprozvirata.cz|language=cs-CZ|access-date=2017-05-05}}</ref>
Korec also supports the animal rights campaign "Konec doby klecové" ("End of the Cage Era") organized by Společnost pro zvířata, with the goal of ending the cage farming of poultry and all other animal species in the Czech Republic,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://spolecnostprozvirata.cz/konecdobyklecove/|title=KONEC DOBY KLECOVÉ {{!}} SPOLEČNOST PRO ZVÍŘATA ZO ČSOP|website=spolecnostprozvirata.cz|language=cs-CZ|access-date=2017-05-05}}</ref> and Česká krajina's biodiversity protection projects focused on the reintroduction of native Czech animal species, such as wild horses, European bisons or aurochs.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.zootabor.eu/en/zoo-tabor-returns-european-bison-to-the-czech-nature/|title=ZOO Tábor Returns European Bison to the Czech Nature {{!}} ZOO Tábor|last=Tábor|first=Zoo|website=www.zootabor.eu|language=en-US|access-date=2017-05-05}}</ref>
Korec leads a scientific group in Tabor Zoo, which determined for the first time the average lifespan of Cane Corso dogs through a study of a statistically significant group in cooperation with 72 Cane Corso kennels from 25 countries. The research aims to extend the life of Cane Corso dogs. In this publication, the relationship between average lifespan and hair colour was described in mammals for the first time. The research results were published in the ''[[Open Veterinary Journal]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Open Veterinary Journal|url=http://www.openveterinaryjournal.com/2017/Volume%207%20No%202/OVJ-2017-02-036%20E.%20Korec%20et%20al.pdf}}</ref> Korec is a member of the Editorial Board of the US veterinary journal ''Approaches in Poultry, Dairy & Veterinary Sciences''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Approaches in Poultry, Dairy & Veterinary Sciences|url=http://crimsonpublishers.us/apdv/editorial-board.php}}</ref>
==Personal life== Korec is married to Jana, and they have one son.<ref>[http://hn.ihned.cz/c1-57101760-relaxace-u-kapru-koi Relaxing with koi carps]</ref>
==Publications== * ''Co je v domě, není pro mě!'' (Don't Get Your Honey Where You Get Your Money) * ''Koupě bytu pod lupou'' (Flat purchase Under the Magnifying Glass) * ''Pozemky ukrývají poklady'' (Land parcels are hidden treasure) * ''Jak jsem zachránil ZOO v Táboře'' (How I Saved Tabor Zoo).

__NOTOC__ {{Infobox NRHP | name = Federal Reserve Bank of New York Building
(33 Liberty Street) | nrhp_type = nrhp | image = 2015 Federal Reserve Bank of New York from west.jpg | image_size = 275px | caption = (2015) | location = 33 Liberty Street
[[Manhattan]], [[New York City]] | locmapin = Lower Manhattan#New York#USA | map_label = Federal Reserve Bank of New York | coordinates = {{coord|40.708767|-74.008756|region:US_type:landmark|display=title,inline}} | built = 1919–1924, 1935 (eastern extension) | architect = [[York and Sawyer]] | architecture = [[Renaissance Revival architecture|Florentine Renaissance]] | added = May 6, 1980 | visitation_num = | visitation_year = | refnum = 80002688 | mpsub = | designated_other2_name = NYC Landmark | designated_other2_date = December 21, 1965 | designated_other2_abbr = NYCL | designated_other2_link = New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission | designated_other2_number = | designated_other2_color = #ffe978 | governing_body = private }} The '''Federal Reserve Bank of New York Building''' at '''33 Liberty Street''', which occupies the full block between [[Liberty Street (Manhattan)|Liberty]], [[William Street (Manhattan)|William]] and [[Nassau Street (Manhattan)|Nassau]] Streets and [[Maiden Lane (Manhattan)|Maiden Lane]] in the [[Financial District, Manhattan|Financial District]] of [[Manhattan]], [[New York City]], is the headquarters of the [[Federal Reserve Bank of New York]]. It is where the [[monetary policy of the United States]] is executed by trading [[dollars]] and [[United States Treasury security|United States Treasury securities]].[http://www.newyorkfed.org/aboutthefed/whatwedo.html "What We Do"] [[Federal Reserve Bank of New York]] The building also hosts a vault containing the world's largest depository of gold, stored on behalf of numerous government institutions from around the world.{{cite web|url=https://www.newyorkfed.org/aboutthefed/goldvault.html|title=Gold Vault|accessdate=2016-08-16|publisher=Federal Reserve Bank of New York}} Total holdings in 2015 amounted to approximately 6,350 tons of gold. Relatively little of this gold belongs to the United States Government; as of August 2016, the building's vault holds {{convert|13400000|ozt|ST}} of gold bullion and $3 million (book value) in gold coins for the United States, a little more than 5% of the United States' total gold reserve.[https://www.fiscal.treasury.gov/fsreports/rpt/goldRpt/current_report.htm "Status Report of U.S. Government Gold Reserves"] [[Bureau of the Fiscal Service]], [[United States Department of the Treasury]] (September 30, 2015) The building was designated a landmark by the [[New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission]] in 1965,[http://www.neighborhoodpreservationcenter.org/db/bb_files/FED-RESERVE-BANK-ORIG.pdf "Feberal Reserve Bank of New York Designation Report"] [[New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission]] (December 21, 1965) and was added to the [[National Register of Historic Places]] in 1980. ==Building and architecture== [[File:2013 Federal Reserve Bank of New York from William Street top.jpg|thumb|left|325px|The top of the building seen from Maiden Lane]] The visual impact of the [[neo-Renaissance]] structure derives from its monumental size, fortress-like appearance, fine proportions and the overall quality of construction. It set the precedent for many later banks which were greatly influenced by its design. Built from 1919 through 1924, with an extension to the east built in 1935, all designed by [[York and Sawyer]] with decorative ironwork by [[Samuel Yellin]] of Philadelphia,{{cite aia5}}, p.38{{cite nycland}}, p.13–14 this massive building occupies an entire city block, reaching fourteen stories tall with five additional floors underground.{{cite landmarks}} p.548 The building tapers to become very narrow at its east end, following the footprint of the block it stands on. The stone exterior of the building is reminiscent of an early [[Italian Renaissance architecture|Italian Renaissance]] [[palace]], such as [[Florence]]'s [[Palazzo Strozzi]] and [[Palazzo Vecchio]], a deliberate choice so as to inspire trust and confidence in the institution within. The horizontal and vertical joints of the facade's stones are deeply grooved or [[rustication (architecture)|rusticated]]. Other features include lanterns and window grills constructed of [[wrought iron]].{{clear left}} ==Vault== The vault rests on Manhattan's [[bedrock]], {{convert|80|ft}} below street level and {{convert|50|ft}} below sea level. The weight of the vault and the gold inside would exceed the weight limits of almost any other foundation.{{cite web|url=http://data.newyorkfed.org/aboutthefed/goldvault.html|title=Gold Vault|publisher=[[Federal Reserve Bank of New York]]|accessdate=2 March 2015}} By 1927, the vault contained 10% of the world's [[official gold reserves]].[http://www.newyorkfed.org/aboutthefed/history_article.html "History"]. [[Federal Reserve Bank of New York]]. Retrieved 2010-03-30. Currently, it is reputedly the largest [[gold]] repository in the world and holds approximately {{convert|7,000|t|ST|lk=on}} of gold bullion ($415 billion as of October 2011), more than [[United States Bullion Depository|Fort Knox]]. Nearly 98% of the gold at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York is owned by the central banks of 36 foreign nations.''Mightiest Bank''. Aired on Monday, 14 November 2011, 7:00pm–8:00pm EST on [[Planet Green]]. 51 minutes. (See also [http://ffh.films.com/id/1666?TrackingID=BVL ''Inside the World’s Mightiest Bank: The Federal Reserve.''] Tug Yourgrau and Pip Gilmour. Princeton, NJ: Films for the Humanities & Sciences. 2000. Originally produced for the Discovery Channel by Powderhouse Productions. Retrieved 14 November 2011) The rest is owned by the United States and international organizations such as the [[IMF]]. The Federal Reserve Bank does not own the gold but serves as guardian of the precious metal, which it stores at no charge to the owners, but charging a $1.75 fee (in 2008) per bar to move the gold. There are elaborate procedures for the handling of the gold, with three different teams monitoring every transaction. Moving the bars requires [[Steel-toe boot|steel-toe footware]] for the staff, to protect their feet in case they drop one of the gold bars weighing {{convert|28|lb|kg|lk=on}}. The vault is open to tourists.Mayerowitz, Scott. [http://abcnews.go.com/Business/story?id=5835433&page=1 "Welcome to the World's Largest Gold Vault"] [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC News]] (September 19, 2008) ==See also== * [[List of New York City Landmarks]] * [[National Register of Historic Places listings in New York County, New York]] ==References== '''Notes''' {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category|Federal Reserve Bank of New York Building}} * {{official website|http://www.newyorkfed.org}} {{New York City Historic Sites|state=collapsed}} {{National Register of Historic Places in New York|state=collapsed}} [[Category:Government buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in Manhattan]] [[Category:Government buildings completed in 1924]] [[Category:Federal Reserve Bank buildings]] [[Category:Financial District, Manhattan]]

'''Gad Zeevi''' (Hebrew: גד זאבי, also Gad Zevi; born November 13, 1939) is an Israeli [[industrialist]]. Zeevi is the owner and chairman of the [[#Zeevi Group|Zeevi Group]],<ref>http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/snapshot.asp?privcapId=2989612 "Gad Zeevi Group"</ref> a multimillion-dollar private equity corporation. The Zeevi Group, through its subsidiaries, produces, refines, and sells [[petroleum]] products. It manages petroleum refineries and a chain of gas stations in the United States. The company also engages in the construction and exploitation of electric power stations, producing electric power for the national network; development, building, and construction of city housing estates, trade centers, places of residence, grain elevators, airports, water projects, and roads in Africa, America, and Israel; and distribution of automobiles. In addition, the Zeevi Group <ref>http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/business/gad-zeevi-borrows-nis-40-million-at-21-interest-1.270353</ref> provides information technologies, logistical, retailing, and other business services, as well as medical equipment and sanatoria.
==Zeevi Group==
The [http://gadzevi.com/ Zeevi Group] purchased "[http://www.subaru-global.com/middle_east.html Japanauto]", the exclusive Israeli distributor for Subaru cars, in 1998. The Gad Zeevi Group invests in private hospitals, radio and television stations, shopping malls, written media,<ref>http://archive.globes.co.il/searchgl/Metis%20chairman%20Amnon%20Barzilai:%20We%20had%20a%20good%20run%20with_s_hd_2L34nEJ4nDbmnC30mDJCnDpWvBcXqRMm0.html 300 Gas Stations</ref> apartment and industrial real estate development, health care, car industry, and more. The Zeevi Group has led energy projects in Africa, America, Europe and Israel, including the construction and exploitation of electric power stations for national networks, trade in crude oil and oil products.
==International Power & Energy Investments ==
The Zeevi Group <ref>http://www.spoke.com/info/pEzfJx8/GadZeevi</ref> has led energy projects in Africa, America, Europe and Israel, including the construction and exploitation of electric power stations for national networks, trade in crude oil and oil products.
==Real Estate Development==
The Zeevi Group has been involved in various ventures across a quarter of a century, including the development, construction and management of large-scale urban projects, commercial and residential complexes, silos, airports, water projects, and thousands of kilometers of roads in Africa and Israel.
The Group owns significant real estate interests, comprising thousands of residential and commercial areas, hospitals and retirement villages:
* Over 1 million m² in Israel * Over 500,000m² in Eastern Europe * 2,000 residential apartments and 300,000 m² of new commercial areas in USA
The Zeevi Group also owns the largest shopping center in Israel, covering a total area of 250,000 m².
==Private Hospitals==
The Zeevi Group owns Israel’s largest private hospitals, equipped with the most updated medical equipment, including VCT, MRI, IVF, laser operations and a state-of-the-art pressure chamber. The Group also owns luxury retirement villages, situated in proximity to the hospitals.
==Media & Telecommunications==
The Zeevi Group has interests in regional and international television and radio companies including Keshet, one of Israel's leading broadcasting agencies.
==Online Skill Gaming==
<ref>http://archive.globes.co.il/searchgl/The%20investment%20by%20ad%20agency%20Adler%20Chomsky%20is%20in%20cash_s_hd_2L34oCJGuCrmnC30mDJOqCp8oBcXqRMm0.html Play4Skill</ref> Play4Skill's business model is based on fee games that include on-site advertising, as well as games for pay. The company is developing an additional B2B business model to license its products to portals and online games sites. Gad Zeevi controls the company, after investing $2.1 million in it in 2009.
==Freight Moving & Logistics - Komatsu & Mack Trucks==
Throughout the 1970-80's, operating in Israel, U.S.A, Africa and Eastern Europe, all The Zeevi Group’s logistics companies have been leaders in their field, ranging from freight forwarding and customs clearance, to inland port terminals, container handling, storage and third party logistics.
==Exclusive Importer of Subaru Cars & Parts==
The Gad Zeevi Group purchased Japanauto, the Israeli distributor of [[Subaru]] cars, in 1998. has been marketing Subaru since 1968 and was a pioneer in bringing Japanese cars to the Israeli market, holding 50% of the local car market in the 1970s and 1980s with annual sales of over 30,000 vehicles. Under The Zeevi Group’s guidance, the company established the biggest after-sales service infrastructure in Israel, providing the reach, the people, the know-how, and the service centers needed to satisfy this highly demanding market. Being the sole importer in the country to market a single brand, while the competition represent various brands with conflicting interests, Japanauto is currently looking for strategically synergetic franchising opportunities to expand by providing new brands, models, car sizes and engine volumes to fit the Israeli market. Various speculation in Israel has arisen towards Mr. Zeevi's plans to expand his car importation enterprise. One of Israel's leading financial newspaper, [[Globes]], recently reported that the Ze'vi Group will be exclusively importing <ref>http://archive.globes.co.il/searchgl/The%20starting%20price%20of%20a%20Maserati%20in%20Israel%20will%20reportedly_s_hd_2L34oCpWmD5mnC30mDJatCpGpBcXqRMm0.html Ferarri & Maserati Cars</ref> into Israel.
The Israeli car market sells 180,000 cars annually with potential growth of over 6% a year. Gad Zeevi has imported and sold hundreds of thousands of Subaru cars to Israel.
According to [http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-1000803861 Globes Magazine], Gad Zeevi sold his shares of Japanauto Holdings Ltd. for an estimated 160 million NIS (~50 million USD) in May 2012. Japan Auto Holdings is the publicly traded parent company of the Subaru importer.
==Privatization of Balkan Bulgarian Airlines==
Zeevi Group was involved in the privatization of Balkan Bulgarian Airlines in Bulgaria.Gets national air carrier Balkan with preferences for future development and sell it for a quick profit .
==Legal Problems & Acquittal==
In March 2011, The Tel Aviv Magistrate’s Court acquitted Gad Ze’evi and three other executives from Malam of charges of fraud.
The trial against Ze’evi lasted five years and included dozens of court hearings. Ze’evi who was chairman of IT giant Malam Systems was indicted in 2006 of committing stock fraud in order to increase his monthly salary. In her closing remarks, as published in both the [http://www.jpost.com/Headlines/Article.aspx?id=211138 Jerusalem Post] & [http://www.globes.co.il/serveen/globes/docview.asp?did=1000628308&fid=1725 Globes] daily newspapers, Judge Daniela Cherizli criticized the local Israeli district attorneys office for drawing out the trial unnecessarily.
"I am not going into personal issues. I kept the verdict professional and objective, even though I strongly wanted to say what I thought during the hearing. Things could have been much shorter," Judge Cherizli told the prosecutors. "I did not halt the hearing only out of the respect that I have for the prosecution. It was really irrelevant."
Judge Cherizli added that the legal material was clear, and so was the required verdict. "At the end of the day, everything focused on the issue of the shares. I made no normative statement whether the shares were tainted or not, but I think that act by the accused was neither false nor unreasonable. I thoroughly examined all the material. In general, I think that Mr. Tiber did not err according to the specific material in this case." Judge Cherizli also criticized the Israel Securities Authority for not providing an opinion on the case. "I would have expected the Securities Authority to express an opinion, but it did not do so, so what I am expected to do? The grounds for a charge of fraudulent receiving have been undercut. More than necessary, I discussed the question whether there were misleading details in the various documents. There was no conspiracy, and I therefore acquit the accused of all charges in the indictment."
==Philanthropy==
Gad Zeevi regularly donates to local and international art museums, schools, health and education and in Jan 2011 he personally donated 200,000 NIS in vehicles and parts to Elem, a Haifa-based charity organization which focuses on assisting needy children with food, clothing, education and social activities.

{{For|the book by Sidney and Beatrice Webb|Industrial Democracy}} {{Democracy}} {{Template:Social democracy sidebar|ideas}}
'''Industrial democracy''' is an arrangement which involves workers making decisions, sharing responsibility and [[authority]] in the workplace. While in [[participative management]] [[organizational design]]s workers are listened to and take part in the [[decision-making]] process, in organizations employing industrial democracy they also have the final decisive power (they decide about organizational design and [[hierarchy]] as well).<ref name="shopfloor democracy">{{cite book | title=Shop Floor Democracy in Action | publisher=Russell Press | author=Rayton, D. | year=1972 | location=Nottingham}}</ref>
In company law, the term generally used is [[co-determination]], following the German word ''Mitbestimmung''. In Germany, companies with more than 2000 employees (or more than 1000 employees in the coal and steel industries) have half of their supervisory boards of directors (which elect management) elected by the shareholders and half by the workers.
Although industrial democracy generally refers to the organization model in which workplaces are run directly by the people who work in them in place of [[Private sector|private]] or [[state ownership]] of the [[means of production]], there are also representative forms of industrial democracy. Representative industrial democracy includes decision-making structures such as the formation of [[committees]] and consultative bodies to facilitate communication between [[management]], [[trade union|unions]], and [[Employee|staff]].
== Rationale == Advocates often point out that industrial democracy increases [[productivity]] and service delivery from a more fully engaged and [[happiness|happier]] [[workforce]]{{Citation needed|reason=Assertion without any supporting sources|date=July 2017}}. Other benefits include less industrial dispute resulting from better communication in the workplace; improved and inclusive decision-making processes resulting in qualitatively better workplace decisions, decreased stress and increased well-being, an increase in [[job satisfaction]], a reduction in [[absenteeism]] and an improved sense of fulfillment{{Citation needed|reason=Multiple assertions without any supporting material|date=July 2017}}. Other authors regard industrial democracy as a consequence of citizenship rights{{Citation needed|reason=Weasel word, Which authors?|date=July 2017}}.
== Works councils and workers' participation ==
{{Main|Works council}} At the point of production, the introduction of mandatory works councils and voluntary schemes of workers' participation (e.g. semi-autonomous groups) have a long tradition in European countries.<ref>Joel Rogers/Wolfgang Streeck (eds.): ''Works Councils. Consultation, Representation, and Cooperation in Industrial Relations'', The University of Chicago Press, Chicago-London 1995. - Thomas Sandberg; 'Work Organization and Autonomous Groups'', LiberFörlag, Uppsala 1982.</ref>
== Co-determination ==
{{Main|Co-determination}} In a number of European countries, employees of a business take part in election of company directors. In Germany, the law is known as the ''[[Mitbestimmungsgesetz]] of 1976''. In Britain a 1977 proposal for a similar system was named the [[Bullock Report]].
== History == {{Libertarian socialism |Economics}} The [[Anarchism|anarchist]] thinker [[Pierre-Joseph Proudhon]] used the term "industrial democracy" in the 1850s to describe the vision of workplace democracy he had first raised in the 1840s with ''[[What Is Property?|What is Property? Or, an Inquiry into the Principle of Right and of Government]]'', (management "must be chosen from the workers by the workers themselves, and must fulfil the conditions of eligibility.") He repeated this call in later works like ''General Idea of the Revolution.''<ref>''[http://www.property-is-theft.org/ Property is Theft! A Pierre-Joseph Proudhon Anthology]''. Edinburgh/Oakland: AK Press. p. 610, p. 119, pp. 586-7</ref>
In late nineteenth century, and at the beginning of the twentieth century, industrial democracy, along with [[anarcho-syndicalism]] and [[new unionism]], represented one of the dominant themes in [[revolutionary socialism]] and played a prominent role in international [[labour movement]]s. The term industrial democracy was also used by British socialist reformers [[Sidney Webb|Sidney]] and [[Beatrice Webb]] in their 1897 book ''[[Industrial Democracy]]''. The Webbs used the term to refer to trade unions and the process of [[collective bargaining]].<ref name="ID">{{cite journal |last=Müller-Jentsch|first=Walther|title=Industrial Democracy: Historical Development and Current Challenges|journal=Management Revue|date=December 16, 2007|volume=19 | issue = 4 |pages=260–273|url=http://www.management-revue.org/papers/mrev_4_08_Mueller-Jentsch.pdf|accessdate=17 August 2010}}</ref>
While the influence of the movements promoting industrial democracy declined after the defeat of the anarchists in the [[Spanish Revolution of 1936|Spanish Revolution]] in 1939, several unions and organizations advocating the arrangement continue to exist and are again on the rise internationally.
The [[Industrial Workers of the World]] advance an [[industrial unionism]] which would organize all the workers, regardless of skill, gender or race, into [[One Big Union (concept)|one big union]] divided into a series of departments corresponding to different industries. The industrial unions would be the embryonic form of future [[post-capitalist]] production. Once sufficiently organized, the industrial unions would overthrow capitalism by means of a [[general strike]], and carry on production through worker run enterprises without bosses or the wage system. [[Anarcho-syndicalism|Anarcho-syndicalist]] unions, like the ''[[Confederación Nacional del Trabajo]]'', are similar in their means and ends but organize workers into geographically based and federated syndicates rather than industrial unions.
The New Unionism Network also promotes [[workplace democracy]] as a means to linking production and [[economic democracy]].
== Representative industrial democracy ==
Modern industrial economies have adopted several aspects of industrial democracy to improve productivity and as reformist measures against industrial disputes. Often referred to as "teamworking", this form of industrial democracy has been practiced in Scandinavia, Germany, the Netherlands and the UK as well as in several Japanese companies such as [[Toyota]], as an effective alternative to [[Taylorism]].
The term is often used synonymously with [[workplace democracy]], in which the traditional master-servant model of [[employment]] gives way to a participative, power-sharing model.
== See also ==

{{Infobox officeholder |image = |imagesize = 150px | |name = Isha Johansen |nationality = Sierra Leonean ||order = President of the [[Sierra Leone Football Association]] |term_start = August 3, 2013 |term_end = |predecessor1 =[[Nahim Khadi]] |birth_date = |birth_place = [[Freetown]], [[Sierra Leone]] |birth_name = Isha Tejan-Cole |dead = |ethnicity = |party = |spouse = Arne Birger Johansen |residence = [[Freetown]], [[Sierra Leone]]
[[Chelsea, London]] |religion = |ethnic group = }} '''Isha Tejan-Cole Johansen''' (born c. 1965{{cite web |url=http://venturesafrica.com/the-sierra-leonean-entrepreneur-and-football-enthusiast-isha-johansen/ |title=Meet Isha Johansen - Sierra Leonean Entrepreneur and Football Enthusiast |author=OluwaBusayo Sotunde |date=October 10, 2012 |website=venturesafrica.com |quote=The 47-year old business savvy entrepreneur ...}}) is a [[Sierra Leone]]an [[entrepreneur]] and the current president of the [[Sierra Leone Football Association]]. Johansen is one of only a few women in the world to have headed a national football association,{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23560252|title=BBC Sport - Johansen confirmed as SLFA president|author=Mohamed Fajah Barrie|work=BBC Sport}} along with [[Lydia Nsekera]], the former president of the Burundi football association, [[Izetta Sombo Wesley]], the former leader of the [[Liberia Football Association]] and [[Sonia Bien-Aime]] of the [[Turks and Caicos Islands Football Association]].{{cite news |url=http://www.sportsnet.ca/soccer/sierra-leone-football-association-to-have-first-female-president/ |title=Johansen to be first female president of SLAFA |date=August 2, 2013 |agency=[[Associated Press]] |website=sportsnet.ca}} Isha Johansen is the owner and [[Chief executive officer|CEO]] of [[Sierra Leone National Premier League]] club [[F.C. Johansen]]. ==Early life and family== Isha Johansen was born as Isha Tejan-Cole in [[Freetown]], [[Sierra Leone]], into the Tejan-Cole family, who are of [[Oku people (Sierra Leone)|Aku]] or [[Sierra Leone Creole|Creole]] descent. She was immersed in football from the very beginning, as her father co-founded [[East End Lions F.C.]] in Freetown.{{cite news |title=Sierra Leone's FA president Isha Johansen: Meet Africa's most powerful woman in football |author=Lydia Smith |newspaper=[[International Business Times]] |date=November 21, 2015 |url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/sierra-leones-fa-president-isha-johansen-meet-africas-most-powerful-woman-football-1529757}} Her father took her to see football matches, and she played football with her brothers and their friends. She was educated at a convent school in Freeport and a boarding school in [[Yeovil]], England.{{cite news |title=Sierra Leone's Isha Johansen blazes trail amid tragedy and infighting |author=Anna Kessel |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |date=January 24, 2015 |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/jan/24/sierra-leone-isha-johansen-ebola-sexism}} She was raised in a religious [[Muslim]] family. She is married to the [[Norway|Norwegian]] Consul in Sierra Leone, Arne Birger Johansen. ==Football== Isha Johansen founded her own football club, [[F.C. Johansen]], in 2004. The club was started with the objective of giving guidance and opportunities to children whose lives had been disrupted by the recent [[Sierra Leone Civil War]] (1991-2002). It began playing in Division One in 2011 and was promoted to the Premier League the following year. Johansen was elected president of the Sierra Leone Football Association (SLFA) unopposed on 3 August 2013,{{cite web|url=http://africayoungvoices.com/2013/08/isha-johansen-becomes-first-woman-slfa-president/|title=ISHA JOHANSEN becomes first woman SLFA President|work=africayoungvoices.com}} after her main opponent, former Sierra Leone international footballer [[Mohamed Kallon]] was disqualified by the Sierra Leone Football Executive committee for not meeting the SLFA [[residency (domicile)|residency]] requirement in the country.{{cite web|url=http://www.insidethegames.biz/sports/summer/football/1015306-fresh-turmoil-in-sierra-leone-football-elections-as-former-player-kallon-disqualified|title=Fresh turmoil in Sierra Leone football elections as former player Kallon disqualified|work=insidethegames.biz}}{{cite web|url=http://allafrica.com/stories/201308010912.html|title=allAfrica.com: Sierra Leone: Kallon, Rodney React to SLFA Disqualification|work=allAfrica.com}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23549250|title=BBC Sport - Fifa endorses decision to ban Kallon from SLFA election|author=Mohamed Fajah Barrie|work=BBC Sport}} Kallon appealed his disqualification, but the [[FIFA]] delegation to Freetown confirmed the disqualifications of Kallon and two other candidates (for links to gambling), so Johansen was unopposed. When [[Sepp Blatter]] was pressured to step down as head of FIFA, Johansen was touted as a possible successor in the press.{{cite web |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2015/06/03/football/fifa-sepp-blatter-football-isa-johansen/ |title=FIFA elections: Should football elect a woman to replace Sepp Blatter? |author=James Masters |date=February 4, 2016 |publisher=[[CNN]]}}{{cite web |url=http://www.eurosport.com/football/why-can-t-isha-johansen-be-fifa-s-first-female-president_sto4993593/story.shtml |title=Why can't Isha Johansen be FIFA's first female president? |author=Desmond Kane |date=November 18, 2015 |publisher=[[Eurosport]]}} She launched Powerplay, an initiative to encourage women and girls to play the game and to help empower them. It has the support of FIFA and the [[Confederation of African Football]]. She also started the annual African International Youth Tournament in 2009. On 7 September 2016, SLFA President Isha Johansen, Vice President Brima Kamara and Secretary General Christopher Kamara were jailed by the Anti-corruption Commission for failing to provide reports regarding the SLFA's financial statements and the use of money.{{cite news |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-leone-football-corruption-idUKKCN11E02I |title=Sierra Leone Football Association officials arrested by anti-graft agency |author= Umaru Fofana |date=8 September 2016 |agency=[[Reuters]]}} The trio were released after posting bail.{{cite news |url=http://www.espnfc.us/sierra-leone/story/2946073/top-sierra-leone-fa-officials-spend-night-in-jail-in-corruption-investigation |title=Top Sierra Leone FA officials spend night in jail in corruption investigation |date=8 September 2016 |agency=[[Associated Press]]}} FIFA defended the SLFA in a letter, stating, "FIFA has no reason to suspect there has been misuse of funds that FIFA has provided to the SLFA", having audited the SLFA's accounts earlier in the year.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37432190 |title=Fifa backs Sierra Leone FA in use of funds |date=21 September 2016 |publisher=BBC News}} ==Other activities== In 1993, she became the first woman publisher in the country's history, producing ''Rapture Magazine'', an entertainment publication. She was also contributing editor to ''Ovation'' magazine. She founded the Pink Charity Fund to combat [[breast cancer]] in 2006 and the Women of Excellence Awards. ==References== {{reflist|30em}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Johansen, Isha}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Sierra Leonean businesspeople]] [[Category:Sierra Leonean women in business]] [[Category:Association football executives]] [[Category:Football people in Sierra Leone]]

[[Image:Isofix anchorpoints.jpg|thumb|Isofix anchor points under a removable cover]] '''ISOFIX''' is the international standard for attachment points for [[child safety seat]]s in passenger cars. The system has other regional names including '''LATCH''' ("Lower Anchors and Tethers for Children") in the [[United States]] and '''LUAS''' ("Lower Universal Anchorage System") or '''Canfix''' in [[Canada]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.car-safety.org/latch.html |title=Information on LATCH (Lower Anchors and Tethers for CHildren) |work=Car-Safety.Org |date=February 29, 2008 |accessdate=2008-07-06}}</ref> It has also been called the "Universal Child Safety Seat System" or '''UCSSS'''.
ISOFIX is [[International Organisation for Standardisation]] standard ISO 13216, which specifies the anchoring system for [[Child_safety_seat#Group_1|Group 1]] child safety seats. It defines standard attachment points to be manufactured into cars, enabling compliant child safety seats to be quickly and safely secured. ISOFIX is an alternative to securing the seat with [[seat belt]]s. Seats are secured with a single attachment at the top (top tether) and two attachments at the base of each side of the seat. The full set of anchor points for this system were required in new cars in the United States starting in September 2002.
In the EU the system is known as ISOFIX and covers both [[Child_safety_seat#Group_0+|Group 0/0+]] and Group 1 child safety seats. The mechanism for attaching the seat to the Lower Anchors is quite different from that in the United States. In the EU two "alligator-like" clips connect the seat to the Lower Anchors rather than the open clip style connectors commonly used in the United States.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://kidsincars.blogspot.com/search/label/LATCH |title=Information on ISOFIX/LATCH |work=Car Safety for Kids Blog |date=May 8, 2008 |accessdate=2009-08-03}}</ref> However, some child seat manufacturers are beginning to offer true ISOFIX type attachments in the U.S. In the European standard, there are also various installation categories: "universal", "vehicle-specific" and "semi-universal". The main difference is that "Universal" represents use of a top tether [[strap]] with the ISOFIX anchorage, "vehicle-specific" represents the usage of the ISOFIX anchorage without the top tether in specified vehicles only, while "Semi-Universal" represents usage of the ISOFIX anchorage together with a "foot-prop".<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.britax-roemer.de/upload/download/typenliste/17/DUO%20plus%20Typenliste.pdf | title=DUO plus Typenliste| accessdate=June 26, 2008}}{{Dead link |date=March 2012 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.britax-roemer.de/upload/download/typenliste/13/SAFEFIX%20plus%20Typenliste.pdf | title=SAFEFIX plus Typenliste | accessdate=June 26, 2008}}{{Dead link |date=March 2012 }}</ref>
Isofix is designed to secure a maximum combined weight (comprising both seat and child) of 33kg.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.bebeconfort.com/car-seats/car-seat-safety/choosing-a-child-car-seat/why-choose-isofix.aspx#|title=Why choose an ISOFIX car seat?|website=www.bebeconfort.com|access-date=2018-02-11}}</ref>
The center-to-center distance between the anchors of ISOFIX (and also LATCH) systems is 280 mm.
For [[Child_safety_seat#Group_2|Group 2]]/[[Child_safety_seat#Group_3|3]] seats there is a system called ISOFIT which anchors the seat to the vehicle so it cannot slide around when not in use. In the case of Isofit, the child is held into the seat using the vehicle's existing seat belt system, not the safety seat's straps.
On September 19, 2014, the Australian government legalized the use of ISOFIX child seats. Prior to this date, their sale (and use) in Australia was illegal.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.caradvice.com.au/308969/isofix-seats-legalised-for-australia | title=ISOFIX child seats legalised for Australia}}</ref>
==History==
The ISOFIX system was developed jointly by child safety seat maker [[Britax|Britax-Römer]] and automobile maker [[Volkswagen|VW]], with the first compatible products released in 1997.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.britaxusa.com/learning-center/history-heritage | title=Britax history and heritage | accessdate=April 1, 2014}}</ref>
ISO 13216 part 1 (covering lower anchorage points) was published in 1999. Part 2, covering top tether anchorages was published in December 2004.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.iso.org/iso/home/store/catalogue_tc/catalogue_detail.htm?csnumber=30437 | title=ISO 13216-1:1999 | accessdate=April 1, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.iso.org/iso/home/store/catalogue_tc/catalogue_detail.htm?csnumber=36058 | title=ISO 13216-2:2004 | accessdate=April 1, 2014}}</ref>
Amendments to include ISOFIX in UN ECE Regulations 14 & 44, which specify uniform provisions for the design of vehicle seat anchorages and child safety seats, came into force in February 2004.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.unece.org/fileadmin/DAM/trans/doc/2003/wp29/TRANS-WP29-2003-38e.pdf | title=United Nations ECE Working Party on Passive Safety - Proposal for draft supplement 5 to the 03 series of amendments to Regulation No 44 | accessdate=April 1, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.unece.org/fileadmin/DAM/trans/main/wp29/wp29regs/r044r2e.pdf | title=UN ECE Regulation No 44 | accessdate=April 1, 2014}}</ref>
Under the current UN/ECE R14, all new vehicles produced since February 2013 are required to have ISOFIX lower anchorages and top tether attachments.

{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2018}} {{Use British English|date=January 2018}} '''James Stedman Dixon''' (8 January 1845 – 18 July 1911) was a leading Scottish coal-mine owner, President of the Mining Institute of Scotland and of the Institution of Mining Engineers of Great Britain, and founder of the James S. Dixon Chair of Applied Geology in the [[University of Glasgow]].
== Early life and education == James Stedman Dixon was born at Glasgow on 8 January 1845, son of stockbroker Peter Watson Dixon and Jane Dow. The family moving to Hamilton in 1850, James Dixon attended the prestigious [[Hamilton Academy]] school, later attending classes in engineering at the [[University of Glasgow]] under [[William John Macquorn Rankine|Professor Macquorn Rankine]].<ref name=autogenerated1>[http://gdl.cdlr.strath.ac.uk/eyrwho/eyrwho0510.htm University of Strathclyde archive. Who’s Who in Glasgow 1909. James Stedman Dixon] Retrieved 30 December 2010</ref>
== Career == Apprenticed in 1863 to George Simpson, mining engineer of Glasgow, Dixon was to be made a partner in the Simpson firm in 1869, and on George Simpson’s death in 1871, took over the whole business. In the following year, Dixon started the Bent Colliery Company which was to become the largest mining operation in the Hamilton area. In 1890 Dixon expanded his interests by acquiring the mining division of James Dunlop and Co., of [[Clyde Iron Works]], subsequently giving up his engineering business to concentrate on his mining interests which between them were producing some 1,250,000 tons of mined coal per annum. By 1898 his Bent Colliery business having greatly increased, Dixon was able to give up his interest in the Dunlop concern to concentrate on other interests, becoming Chairman of the Broxburn Oil Company and a director of both the Edinburgh Colliery Company and the Plean Colliery, among other business concerns.<ref name=autogenerated1 />
== Appointments and interests == Dixon was twice elected to serve as President of the Lanarkshire Coalmasters' Association, and was to become the first President of the Coalmasters' Insurance Association, formed as a result of the requirements of the [[Workmen's Compensation Act 1897|Workmen's Compensation Act]]. He was later to serve (twice) as President of the Mining Institute of Scotland (eventually through mergers becoming in 2002 the [[Institute of Materials, Minerals and Mining]]),<ref>[http://www.mining-scotland.org/history.htm Mining Institute of Scotland - list of Presidents] Retrieved 30 December 2010</ref> and as President of the Institution of Mining Engineers of Great Britain; and was appointed to the Royal Commission on Coal Supplies.
In 1902 Dixon endowed a Lectureship in Mining Engineering in the [[University of Glasgow]] increasing this endowment in 1907 to found the '''James S. Dixon Chair of Mining''', appointments being made jointly between the University of Glasgow and the Royal Technical College (renamed in 1956 the [[Royal College of Science and Technology]] and in 1964 becoming the [[University of Strathclyde]]). In 1932, another notable former pupil of [[Hamilton Academy]], [[Andrew Bryan (engineer)|Andrew Bryan]] was appointed to this Chair, as Professor of Mining.<ref>[http://www.universitystory.gla.ac.uk/chair-and-lectureship/?id=837 University of Glasgow. The James S. Dixon Chair in Mining] Retrieved 30 December 2010</ref> The founding ordnance being repealed in 1980, in 1989 the funds were relocated to found the present '''James S. Dixon Chair of Applied Geology''' in the University of Glasgow. For his services to education, James Dixon was awarded the degree of [[Legum Doctor|LLD]] by the university.<ref>[http://www.universitystory.gla.ac.uk/biography/?id=WH0034&type=P University of Glasgow. Biography – James Stedman Dixon, alumnus and benefactor] Retrieved 30 December 2010</ref>
In addition, Dixon founded the '''Dr. James S. Dixon Bursary in Mining Engineering''' for pupils in technical subjects at [[Hamilton Academy]], to assist them in attending the University of Glasgow, Faculty of Engineering.<ref>[https://books.google.com/books?id=28JNAAAAYAAJ&q=dr.+james+s.+dixon+bursary&dq=dr.+james+s.+dixon+bursary&hl=en&ei=dskbTbzcB8ayhAeGhoG3Dg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&sqi=2&ved=0CCgQ6AEwAA Google Books. University of Glasgow Calendar 1938 - the Dr. James S. Dixon Bursary in Mining Engineering for pupils in technical subjects at Hamilton Academy, to attend the University of Glasgow] Retrieved 30 December 2010</ref> As a university benefactor, James Stedman Dixon is formally remembered annually on Glasgow University’s Commemoration Day.<ref>[http://www.universitystory.gla.ac.uk/commemoration-day University of Glasgow – annual Commemoration Day. List of commemorated benefactors] Retrieved 30 December 2010</ref>
A leading member of the Conservative Party in Lanarkshire, Dixon twice served as President of North-East Lanarkshire Conservative Association, in addition to his appointments as a [[Justice of the peace|J.P.]] and Income Tax Commissioner for Lanarkshire. Married to Isabella Douglas in 1883, the couple had no children.
James Stedman Dixon died at his home, Fairleigh, in [[Bothwell]], South Lanarkshire, on 18 July 1911.<ref>[https://books.google.com/books?ei=fcgbTemiF8ubhQf75dy4Dg&ct=result&id=I8AlAQAAIAAJ&dq=James+Stedman+Dixon+July+1911&q=Fairleigh#search_anchor Institution of Mining Engineers of Great Britain. Transactions, volume 42, page 47 – obituary James Stedman Dixon] Retrieved 30 December 2010</ref>

{{Infobox person |name = Judith Briles |birth_date = |birth_place = |image =File:JB photo-EX.jpg |caption = |residence = [[Denver, Colorado]] |nationality = [[United States|American]] |known_for = |education = Doctorate of Business Administration |alma_mater = |employer = |occupation = Author, publishing expert |home_town = |religion = |website = {{URL|http://thebookshepherd.com/ TheBookShepherd.com}}}} '''Judith Briles''' is an [[author]], [[publisher]], consultant and professional [[motivational speaker|speaker]] focused in the fields of finance and book publishing.<ref>[http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2006/aug/23/20060823-122252-7667r/?page=all "Nearly half of women fear life as a bag lady"] ''Washington Times''. Retrieved 27 October 2013.</ref>
She is best known for being the founder of Author U,<ref>[http://www.thebookdesigner.com/2012/03/authors-cant-be-too-pooped-to-market/ "Authors Can’t Be Too Pooped to Market!"] ''The Book Designer''. Retrieved 27 October 2013.</ref> the co-founder of Mile High Press,<ref>[http://www.pginvestor.com/phoenix.zhtml?c=104574&p=irol-newsArticle&ID=628952&highlight= "The Road to Confidence may run through your Closet"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924072149/http://www.pginvestor.com/phoenix.zhtml?c=104574&p=irol-newsArticle&ID=628952&highlight= |date=2015-09-24 }} ''P&G Investor''. Retrieved 14 May 2013.</ref> and was [[KWGN-TV|CW2 Denver’s]] financial expert in the mid-2000s. Briles has been referred to as the "Book Shepherd" and is an advocate for author’s rights.<ref>[http://www.nsacolorado.org/interview-with-publishing-expert-judith-briles-the-book-shepherd/ "Interview with Publishing Expert Judith Briles, the “Book Shepherd”] NSA Colorado. Retrieved 14 May 2013.</ref>
==Background== Briles has earned both masters and doctorate of Business Administration degrees. In 2004, she was named the Woman of Distinction by the [[Girl Scouts of the United States of America]].<ref>[https://www.girlscoutsofcolorado.org/women-of-distinction-denver "Women of Distinction - Denver"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029202128/https://www.girlscoutsofcolorado.org/women-of-distinction-denver |date=2013-10-29 }} Girl Scouts of Colorado. Retrieved 27 October 2013.</ref>
==Career== Briles is the co-founder of Mile High Press, Ltd., a small press and The Briles Group, Inc., a former Colorado-based research, training and consulting firm.<ref>[http://www.bizjournals.com/denver/morning_call/2011/05/business-travel-takes-its-toll-on-body.html "Business travel takes its toll on body"] ''Denver Business Journal''. Retrieved 15 May 2013.</ref> She now owns The Book Shepherd, a consulting and implementation firm that works with authors and small publishers.
Briles is an author of over thirty books including ''Show Me About Book Publishing'' with Rick Frishman and John Kremer, ''The Confidence Factor'' and ''Stabotage!''<ref>[http://www.summitdaily.com/article/20021018/AE/210180605 "Bash draws authors off the page"] ''Summit Daily''. Retrieved 27 October 2013.</ref> She also travels internationally as a motivational speaker.<ref>[http://starland.com/wp/digifest/guests/ "Guests"] Starland. Retrieved 14 May 2013.</ref><ref>[http://www.bizjournals.com/denver/stories/1998/06/29/tidbits.html?page=all "Elitch's rides on climbing attendance"] ''Denver Business Journal''. Retrieved 27 October 2013.</ref><ref>[http://www.alabamacrna.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/ALANA-Bulletin-2008-v26-3.pdf "Highlights of the ALANA Annual Fall Meeting"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029203407/http://www.alabamacrna.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/01/ALANA-Bulletin-2008-v26-3.pdf |date=2013-10-29 }} ALANA. Retrieved 27 October 2013.</ref>
Her work has been featured in ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'', ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'', ''[[People (magazine)|People]]'',<ref>[http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20098748,00.html "Author Judith Briles Discovers That Women at Work May Be Women at War—usually with Each Other"] ''People''. Retrieved 15 May 2013.</ref> ''[[USA Today]]'',<ref>[http://travel.usatoday.com/news/story/2011/05/Business-travel-takes-toll-on-workers-health/47807470/1 "Business travel takes toll on workers' health"] ''USA Today''. Retrieved 14 May 2013.</ref> ''Self'', ''McCalls'', ''Working Woman'', ''Family Circle'', ''The Washington Post'',<ref>[http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1P2-432043.html "Get Out Your Toolbox; Put a Handle on Life"] ''The Washington Post''. Retrieved 27 October 2013.</ref> ''Newsweek''<ref>[http://www.nbcnews.com/id/3068824/#.UZRq_yvwKeA "No Job Is Safe. Never Will Be."] ''NBC News''. Retrieved 14 May 2013.</ref> and ''[[The New York Times]]''. She is a frequent guest on national television and radio and has appeared on programs including ''[[CNN]]'', ''CNNfn'', ''Oprah'', ''John Gray'', ''MSNBC'' and ''[[Good Morning America]]''.<ref>[http://briles.com/in-the-news/ "In The News"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029202757/http://briles.com/in-the-news/ |date=2013-10-29 }} Retrieved 28 October 2013.</ref>
==Select bibliography== *{{cite book|author = Briles, Judith|title =Woman to Woman: From Sabotage to Support|publisher = New Horizons Press|location = Far Hills, NJ|year = 1987|pages =298 pages|isbn = 978-0882821719}} *{{cite book|author = Briles, Judith|title =Smart-Money Moves for Kids|publisher = Mile High Press|location = Denver, CO|year = 2000|pages =316 pages|isbn = 978-1885331038}} *{{cite book|author = Briles, Judith|title =Money Smarts: Personal Financial Success in 30 Days!|publisher = Mile High Press|location = Denver, CO|year = 2005|pages =288 pages|isbn = 978-1885331199}} *{{cite book|author = Briles, Judith|title =Zapping Conflict in the Health Care Workplace|publisher = Mile High Press|location = Denver, CO|year = 2008|pages =414 pages|isbn = 978-1885331083}} *{{cite book|author = Briles, Judith|title =The Confidence Factor: Cosmic Gooses Lay Golden Eggs|publisher = Mile High Press|location = Denver, CO|year = 2008|pages =176 pages|isbn = 978-1885331090}} *{{cite book|author = Briles, Judith|title =Stabotage!: How to Deal with the Pit Bulls, Skunks, Snakes, Scorpions & Slugs in the Health Care Workplace|publisher = Mile High Press|location = Denver, CO|year = 2008|pages =192 pages|isbn = 978-1885331304}} *{{cite book|author = Briles, Judith|title =Author YOU-Creating and Building Your Author and Book Platforms|publisher = Mile High Press|location = Denver, CO|year = 2013|pages =232 pages|isbn = 978-1885331410}}

Felipe '''Martin de Villamil''' or '''Martin Villamil''' ("Gonzalez de la Galea y Villamil" or "Villamil Joly") (1783-1843) was a trader in the Caribbeans and in Europe.
== In the Caribbeans ==
Martin de Villamil, brother of the Ecuadorian independence hero [[José de Villamil]], was born in [[New Orleans]], [[Spanish Louisiana]], in 1783, son of a trader and administrator (mayordomo) of the hospital of the city. He became a trader in the Caribbean.
In 1809, he married the daughter of the lieutenant of the king of Spain in [[Panama]] (1). Around 1812, he was one of the cofounders of the trade consulate in [[Cartagena, Colombia|Cartagena]]. Later, he lived in [[Jamaica]], where he owned sugar cane plantations.
== In Europe == After that, Martin de Villamil and his family went to Europe: London, Paris, Italy (Bologna, Firenze). In 1820-1822, he welcomed in his villa of Sèvres, near Paris, the great Irish poet [[Thomas Moore]] (1779-1853).
In 1830, Martin Villamil met in Paris the général [[Francisco de Paula Santander]] (1792-1840), hero of the independence of [[Great Colombia]].
In Bologna, he may have been a British consul. In Firenze, Madame Martin de Villamil, was a friend of [[Jérôme Bonaparte]] (brother of [[Napoléon Bonaparte]]), former king of Westphalia, who gave her the guard of his daughter, la [[Mathilde Bonaparte|princesse Mathilde]], and of his house.
Martin de Villamil died in Paris in 1843.
== Sources ==

See : http://www.columbia.edu/itc/mealac/pritchett/00generallinks/lallarookh/intro_rossetti.html and [http://www.columbia.edu/itc/mealac/pritchett/00generallinks/lallarookh/intro_rossetti.html] *(4) about the meeting with Santander (21 May 1830) : ''Diaro del viaje en Europa de F.P. Santander'', on the site of the Banco de la Republica of Colombia : https://web.archive.org/web/20070611105813/http://www.lablaa.org/blaavirtual/historia/diagene/diagen3.doc and [https://web.archive.org/web/20070611105813/http://www.lablaa.org/blaavirtual/historia/diagene/diagen3.doc].

{{EngvarB|date=May 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Mervyn Mau E. King | image = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Mervyn Masiapa Mau Eldred King | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1937|07|22}} | birth_place = [[Johannesburg]] | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} (death date then birth date) --> | death_place = | nationality = South African | other_names = | known_for = [[King Report on Corporate Governance]] | occupation = Attorney, arbitrator, mediator, commission chair }} '''Mervyn Eldred King''' (born 22 July 1937, [[Johannesburg]])<ref name="who"/> is a South African corporate attorney, [[Arbitration|arbitrator]], [[Mediation|mediator]], corporate director, commission chair, author and speaker. A former judge of the [[Supreme Court of South Africa]], he is currently chairman of the [[Integrated reporting#International Integrated Reporting Council|IIRC]], chairman emeritus of the [[Global Reporting Initiative]] and director of the Association of Business Administrators of Southern Africa. He is best known for chairing the [[King Report on Corporate Governance|King Committee on Corporate Governance]], which issued three comprehensive reports in 1994, 2002 and 2009 endorsing an integrated and inclusive approach to [[corporate governance]] in South Africa.<ref name="doc"/>
==Biography== King was born on 22 July 1937 to Aubrey and Mona King. He attended the [[University of the Witwatersrand]], where he earned his Bachelor of Arts, Bachelor of Law, and a higher diploma in tax law.<ref name="who"/>
From 1961 to 1964 he was a practising attorney. From 1965 to 1979 he was an advocate to the Supreme Court of South Africa, specialising in commercial law; he was appointed [[senior counsel]] in 1975. He became a judge of the Supreme Court of South Africa in 1977.<ref name="who">{{cite web |url=http://www.whoswhosa.co.za/mervyn-king-1081 |title=Profile Summary: Mervyn Eldred King |publisher=Who's Who Southern Africa |accessdate=4 August 2011}}</ref> He resigned that post in 1980 – reportedly after an altercation with Prime Minister [[P. W. Botha]]<ref name="int">{{cite web |url=http://www.insideinvestorrelations.com/articles/16371/audience-mervyn-king/ |title=An Audience with the GRI's King |last=Stewart |first=Neil |date=9 September 2010 |accessdate=4 August 2011 |publisher=Inside Investor Relations |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110113123908/http://www.insideinvestorrelations.com/articles/16371/audience-mervyn-king/ |archivedate=13 January 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> – and entered the commercial arena.
He became executive chairman of Frame Group Holdings, a textile giant, and executive chairman of First National Bank's corporate and investment banking group.<ref name="int"/> In later years, he chaired and was a director of Capital Alliance Ltd and Metro Cash & Carry Ltd.<ref name="doc">{{cite web |url=http://www.wits.ac.za/alumni/alumnirecognition/honorarydegreecitations/3608/mervynking.html |title=Citation: An Honorary Doctorate : Mervyn Eldred King, S.C. (B.A., LL.B. [Wits] cum laude) |publisher=[[University of the Witwatersrand]] |year=2010 |accessdate=4 August 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110928033551/http://www.wits.ac.za/alumni/alumnirecognition/honorarydegreecitations/3608/mervynking.html |archivedate=28 September 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
From 1981 to 1989 he was the first chairman of Operation Hunger, a South African charity which aimed to feed children in rural areas; he is now honorary life president of that organisation.<ref name="doc"/>
===Arbitrator and mediator=== King is a founding member of the Arbitration Foundation of Southern Africa. He has acted as a company inspector and commissioner of inquiry into the affairs of companies, and has chaired many meetings to effect compromises for company creditors and on behalf of shareholder interests.<ref name="profile"/> In 1994 he chaired a commission of inquiry into political divisions in athletics, drafting recommendations for future conduct of the sport in South Africa; this was followed up by his second commission investing the sport of tennis.<ref name="doc"/>
===King Report=== {{main|King Report on Corporate Governance}} In July 1993 the Institute of Directors in South Africa asked King to chair the first official committee on corporate governance. The King Committee on Corporate Governance issued its first report (King I), a comprehensive code of corporate practices and conduct, in 1994. King viewed the committee as an opportunity to educate the recently democratized South African public on the principles of working in a free economy.<ref name="int"/> King I was the first report of its kind in South Africa.<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=croQAGwkNi8C&pg=PA339&dq=judge+mervyn+king&hl=en&ei=7Kc6To3VMIOw8gPa05DmAg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=6&ved=0CEUQ6AEwBQ#v=onepage&q=judge%20mervyn%20king&f=false |title=Business Governance Handbook: Principles and practice, Volume 1 |page=339 |last1=Hendrikse |first1=Dr. John W. |last2=Kendrikse |first2=Leigh |publisher=Juta Academic |year=2004 |isbn=0-7021-6499-2}}</ref> In 2002, when the [[Earth Summit 2002|Earth Summit]] was held in Johannesburg, King pushed for a revision of the report (King II), including new sections on [[sustainability]],<ref name="int"/> the role of the corporate board,<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=RGmHAVPhmRwC&pg=PA298&dq=judge+mervyn+king&hl=en&ei=GKw6Tp3NEYmh8QOn_u3zCA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=9&ved=0CE8Q6AEwCDgK#v=onepage&q=judge%20mervyn%20king&f=false |title=Corporate Governance |first1=Robert A. G. |last1=Monks |first2=Nell |last2=Minow |page=298 |publisher=Wiley-Blackwell |year=2003 |isbn=1-4051-1698-6}}</ref> and [[risk management]].<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=9end-Uoo8_gC&pg=PA17&dq=judge+mervyn+king&hl=en&ei=GKw6Tp3NEYmh8QOn_u3zCA&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=5&ved=0CDwQ6AEwBDgK#v=onepage&q=judge%20mervyn%20king&f=false |title=The Executives Guide to Insurance and Risk Management |page=17 |first=Graeme |last=Berwick |publisher=Quality Results Pty Limited |year=2007}}</ref> The report was further revised in 2009 (King III).<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=woqEDQQzGp0C&pg=PT365&dq=judge+mervyn+king&hl=en&ei=-Yg6TtTiDoiZ8QOlzJCKAw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CCgQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=judge%20mervyn%20king&f=false |title= The A to Z of Corporate Social Responsibility |last1=Visser |first1=Wayne |last2=Matten |first2=Dirk |last3=Pohl |first3=Manfred |last4=Tolhurst |first4=Nick|isbn=978-0-470-68650-8}}</ref> Compliance with the King Reports is a requirement for companies listed on the [[Johannesburg Stock Exchange]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.naspers.com/corp-gov-application-approach-king.php |title=Application of and approach to King III |publisher=[[Naspers]] |accessdate=4 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110823004626/http://naspers.com/corp-gov-application-approach-king.php |archivedate=23 August 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.omnia.co.za/pebble.asp?relid=1879 |title=Corporate Governance |publisher=Omnia |accessdate=4 August 2011}}</ref> The King Report on Corporate Governance has been cited as "the most effective summary of the best international practices in corporate governance".<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=MQD4CmMa1tgC&pg=PA317&dq=judge+mervyn+king&hl=en&ei=7Kc6To3VMIOw8gPa05DmAg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=3&ved=0CDQQ6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=judge%20mervyn%20king&f=false |title=Management: Fresh perspectives |page=317 |first=Steve |last=Banhegyi |publisher=Pearson Education South Africa |year=2007|isbn=978-1-86891-594-1}}</ref>
===International arena=== From 2000 to 2008, King was the South African representative on the [[International Chamber of Commerce]]'s [[International Court of Arbitration]] in Paris. He was the first president of the Commonwealth Association of Corporate Governance and a former Governor of the International Corporate Governance Network.<ref name="doc"/>
He is currently a member of the Private Sector Advisory Group to the [[World Bank]] on Corporate Governance and a member of the international advisory boards of [[Stern Stewart]] (US), Tomorrow's Company (United Kingdom), and the Central European Corporate Governance Association. He chairs the Asian Centre of Corporate Governance, the United Nations Committee on Governance and Oversight, and the Global Reporting Initiative. He is the Chairman of the [[Integrated reporting|International Integrated Reporting Council.]]<ref name="doc"/>
In South Africa, King holds the following positions:<ref name="who"/><ref name="doc"/> *Director of JD Group Limited (since 1995) *Director of Brait Societe Anonyme (since 1998) *Director of Strate, the settlement arm for equity trading in South Africa (since 1999) *Director of the Association of Business Administrators of Southern Africa (since 2004) *President of the Advertising Standards Authority *First Vice-President of the Institute of Directors Southern Africa *Chairman of the [[Automobile Association of South Africa]] *Chairman of the Appeal Committee of the [[Cricket South Africa|United Cricket Board of South Africa]] *Member of the Securities Regulation Panel (which oversees all acquisitions and mergers in South Africa)
===Speaker=== King has addressed conferences and lectured on corporate issues in 38 countries. He is a regular speaker on radio and television talk shows and had his own television series, "King on Governance".<ref name="profile">{{cite web |url=http://www.mervynking.co.za/pages/profile.htm|title=Personal Profile|publisher=mervynking.co.za |accessdate=4 August 2011}}</ref>
==Honors and awards== *2010: International Association of Business Communicators Africa Excel Award<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.iabc.co.za/latest-news/excel-awards/194-judge-mervyn-king-awarded-2010-iabc-africa-excel-award.html |title=Judge Mervyn King Awarded 2010 IABC Africa Excel Award |last=Dafel |first=Tertia |date=25 October 2010 |publisher=[[International Association of Business Communicators]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111009162826/http://www.iabc.co.za/latest-news/excel-awards/194-judge-mervyn-king-awarded-2010-iabc-africa-excel-award.html |archivedate=9 October 2011 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> *2010: Honorary doctorate from the University of the Witwatersrand<ref name="doc"/>
==Family== King is married to Elizabeth Mae Miller; they have two sons.<ref name="who"/>
==Bibliography== *{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=6q4WAQAAMAAJ&q=judge+mervyn+king&dq=judge+mervyn+king&hl=en&ei=oq46TsORBoyz8QPdt8GAAw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=8&ved=0CEsQ6AEwBzgU |title=Public Policy and the Corporation |publisher=Chapman and Hall |year=1977 |isbn=0-470-99263-8}} *{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=n3KptiP-rf0C&pg=PA17&dq=judge+mervyn+king&hl=en&ei=7Kc6To3VMIOw8gPa05DmAg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=5&ved=0CD4Q6AEwBA#v=onepage&q&f=false |title=The Taxation of Income from Capital: A Comparative Study of the United States, the United Kingdom, Sweden, and West Germany |publisher=University of Chicago Press |year=1984 |isbn=0-226-43630-6}} (with Don Fullerton) *{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=3a4SAQAAIAAJ&q=judge+mervyn+king&dq=judge+mervyn+king&hl=en&ei=oq46TsORBoyz8QPdt8GAAw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=9&ved=0CE8Q6AEwCDgU |title=The Corporate Citizen: Governance for all entities |publisher=[[Penguin Books]] |year=2006 |isbn=0-14-302508-2}} *{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=9gzdQgAACAAJ&dq=transient+caretakers&hl=en&ei=brU6TvaeIoyq8APb7fmKAw&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CCgQ6AEwAA |title=Transient Caretakers: Making life on earth sustainable |publisher=Pan Macmillan |year=2009 |isbn=1-77010-162-4}} (with Teodorina Lessidrenska)
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.mervynking.co.za/ Personal website]
